segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine, and today we're going to buy some food at a store for, basically, bread.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们要去商店买一些食物，主要是面包。

segments.en: Right, Marco?
That's right.
Today we're going to a bakery.
segments.cn: 今天我们要去一家面包店。

segments.en: So this is basically a shop where they sell bread and different types of bread, actually.
segments.cn: 所以这基本上是一个卖面包和各种面包的商店。

segments.en: That's right.
So we're going to learn all about these different kinds of bread.
segments.cn: 所以我们要了解这些不同种类的面包。

segments.en: Let's take a listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 让我们来听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Welcome to Al's Bakery.
What can I get you?
Hi, let me get a dozen croissants, four blueberry muffins, and a loaf of sourdough bread.
segments.cn: 嗨，我要一打可颂，四个蓝莓松饼和一条酸面包。

segments.en: Sure.
Would you like to have the loaf sliced?
No, that's okay.
Do you have any whole wheat bread?
Oh, we're out at the moment.
May I suggest some rye bread?
segments.cn: 我可以推荐一些黑麦面包吗？

segments.en: Sure, that sounds good.
Do you have any cakes?
We have various birthday cakes and also some ice cream cakes.
segments.cn: 我们有各种生日蛋糕，还有一些冰淇淋蛋糕。

segments.en: I'll just take a cheesecake.
Will that be all?
Yes.
Your total is $43.20.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at some vocab on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们来看看Language Takeaway的一些词汇。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
In Language Takeaway today we have many different kinds of bread.
segments.cn: 在今天的Language Takeaway中，我们有许多不同种类的面包。

segments.en: The first kind actually comes to English from the French language.
segments.cn: 第一种实际上是从法语引入英语的。

segments.en: We have croissants.
That's right, croissants.
Now, as you say, this is a type of bread that comes from France, I guess.
segments.cn: 现在，正如你所说，这是一种来自法国的面包，我想。

segments.en: That's right.
It's really delicious.
It's buttery and flaky, and it's in the shape of a Crescent.
segments.cn: 它是黄油味和酥脆的，形状像新月。

segments.en: So it's like a curve, like a C.
It kind of looks like also horns, because it's got two little... it's got like a horn on each side.
segments.cn: 它看起来也像角，因为两边都有小角。

segments.en: It does, it does.
And many people like to eat this for breakfast in France, but you can find it everywhere in America at cafes and bakeries.
segments.cn: 很多人喜欢在法国早餐时吃这个，但在美国的咖啡馆和面包店随处可见。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
So those are croissants.
And now we're also buying blueberry muffins.
segments.cn: 现在我们还要买蓝莓松饼。

segments.en: Okay, muffins are a delicious baked good.
segments.cn: 好的，松饼是一种美味的烘焙食品。

segments.en: Blueberry muffins are the flavor, so we can also have strawberry or orange.
segments.cn: 蓝莓松饼是口味，所以我们也可以有草莓或橙子口味。

segments.en: But in this case, a muffin is kind of like a sweet baked good.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，松饼有点像甜的烘焙食品。

segments.en: It's round.
So it's kind of like a cake, like a little cake.
segments.cn: 所以它有点像蛋糕，像一个小蛋糕。

segments.en: It is like a little cake.
The top is bigger than the bottom, so the bottom you have some paper to hold on to, and the top is round and maybe a little bit hard.
segments.cn: 顶部比底部大，所以底部有一些纸可以抓住，顶部是圆的，可能有点硬。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
So those are muffins.
We'll post pictures of these on the site so you can see what they look like.
segments.cn: 我们会在网站上发布这些的图片，以便你们可以看到它们的样子。

segments.en: But moving on now, we have a type of bread.
segments.cn: 但现在继续，我们有一种面包。

segments.en: This is a sourdough bread.
Alright, so there are many, many, many different kinds of breads, but sourdough is very unique, because the flavor is a little bit sour.
segments.cn: 好吧，有很多很多不同种类的面包，但酸面包非常独特，因为它的味道有点酸。

segments.en: It's strong.
So dough is the substance or what you use to make bread, right?
segments.cn: 所以面团是制作面包的物质，对吧？

segments.en: Or before bread is baked.
That's right.
So before you make bread, it's kind of like a liquid.
segments.cn: 所以在你制作面包之前，它有点像液体。

segments.en: You have some milk or water that you mix with flour, so you have to hold it in a bowl or a cup.
segments.cn: 你有一些牛奶或水与面粉混合，所以你必须把它放在碗或杯子里。

segments.en: And after you bake it, it becomes hard.
So dough is when it's soft and like a liquid.
segments.cn: 所以面团是软的，像液体。

segments.en: Right, you've seen it when they're making bread, they have this, it looks like a paste sometimes, and then it becomes hard.
segments.cn: 对，你见过他们制作面包时，它看起来有时像糊状，然后变得坚硬。

segments.en: Or when they're making pizzas, that's called dough.
segments.cn: 或者在他们制作比萨时，那叫面团。

segments.en: And sour, obviously, because it has that flavor that you said, a very strong sour flavor.
segments.cn: 而酸，显然是因为它有你所说的那种味道，非常强烈的酸味。

segments.en: That's right.
And a different kind of bread that we might find is whole wheat bread.
segments.cn: 另一种我们可能会找到的面包是全麦面包。

segments.en: Okay, now this is like the healthy choice.
segments.cn: 好的，现在这是一种健康的选择。

segments.en: Yes, it's normally the healthy choice.
segments.cn: 是的，通常是健康的选择。

segments.en: That's because the flour that we put in the dough is whole wheat flour.
segments.cn: 这是因为我们放入面团中的面粉是全麦面粉。

segments.en: It's a little bit healthier.
It's usually a little bit darker than white flour, so it'll be brown.
segments.cn: 通常比白面粉稍微深色，所以它是棕色的。

segments.en: So yeah, it's basically the brown bread.
segments.cn: 所以是的，基本上就是棕色面包。

segments.en: I think if you've noticed when you go to the store and you can get bread, you'll find one that looks white on the inside.
segments.cn: 我想如果你注意到，当你去商店买面包时，你会发现一种看起来内部是白色的面包。

segments.en: And this one actually looks brown on the inside.
segments.cn: 而这个实际上看起来是棕色的。

segments.en: That's right.
And an even more brown colored bread, maybe even black, is rye bread.
segments.cn: 还有一种颜色更深的面包，甚至可能是黑色的，是黑麦面包。

segments.en: So what is rye?
Rye is another kind of grain, and when you bake this rye bread, it has a very strong flavor, and it's very, very dark, almost black.
segments.cn: 黑麦是另一种谷物，当你烘烤这种黑麦面包时，它有非常强烈的味道，而且非常非常深，几乎是黑色的。

segments.en: It's actually my favorite kind of bread.
segments.cn: 其实这是我最喜欢的面包。

segments.en: So what does it taste like, or what's the difference between whole wheat bread and rye bread?
segments.cn: 那它的味道是什么，或者全麦面包和黑麦面包有什么区别？

segments.en: Rye bread is much heavier.
It has a stronger flavor.
Whole wheat bread is lighter.
Okay, very good.
So obviously it may be a little bit difficult to understand the differences between the breads, but we'll post pictures on the site so you can see them.
segments.cn: 所以显然，理解面包之间的差异可能有点困难，但我们会在网站上发布图片，以便你们可以看到它们。

segments.en: And also, you have to go out to the bakery and try them so you can taste the difference.
segments.cn: 而且，你必须去面包店尝试它们，这样你才能品尝到差异。

segments.en: That's right.
All right, so now let's move on to language takeaway part two, and talk about a little bit more of the other vocab found in this lesson.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们继续进行语言外语学习的第二部分，谈谈本课中发现的其他词汇。

segments.en: Welcome to Al's Bakery.
What can I get you?
Hi, let me get a dozen croissants, four blueberry muffins, and a loaf of sourdough bread.
segments.cn: 嗨，我要一打可颂，四个蓝莓松饼和一条酸面包。

segments.en: Sure.
Would you like to have the loaf sliced?
No, that's okay.
Do you have any whole wheat bread?
Oh, we're out at the moment.
May I suggest some rye bread?
segments.cn: 我可以推荐一些黑麦面包吗？

segments.en: Sure, that sounds good.
Do you have any cakes?
We have various birthday cakes and also some ice cream cakes.
segments.cn: 我们有各种生日蛋糕，还有一些冰淇淋蛋糕。

segments.en: I'll just take a cheesecake.
Will that be all?
Yes.
Your total is $43.20.
So when you want to go buy some bread or some baked goods, you have to know how to count those goods.
segments.cn: 所以当你想去买面包或烘焙食品时，你必须知道如何计算这些商品。

segments.en: So today we have a couple of words to help you count bread.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们有几个词来帮助你计算面包。

segments.en: The first one we have is dozen.
That's right.
So for croissants, as you can see, it's a countable noun.
segments.cn: 所以对于可颂，正如你所看到的，这是一个可数名词。

segments.en: And so when you ask for a dozen croissants, you're asking for 12.
segments.cn: 所以当你要一打可颂时，你就是在要12个。

segments.en: That's right.
So in English, the word dozen means 12.
segments.cn: 所以在英语中，“打”这个词意味着12。

segments.en: You can buy a dozen eggs, or in this case, a dozen blueberry muffins maybe.
segments.cn: 你可以买一打鸡蛋，或者在这种情况下，可能是一打蓝莓松饼。

segments.en: Okay, so it's a very popular term, a dozen or a half a dozen.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这是一个非常流行的术语，一打或半打。

segments.en: Sometimes people just buy six.
That's right.
So half a dozen is six.
A whole dozen, just say dozen, is 12.
You can also have something special called a baker's dozen.
segments.cn: 你还可以有一个特别的东西叫做“面包师的打”。

segments.en: Yes, I've heard about this.
What is a baker's dozen?
Well, a baker's dozen is basically a present the baker gives you.
segments.cn: 嗯，“面包师的打”基本上是面包师给你的礼物。

segments.en: So you buy 12, maybe 12 croissants, and the baker gives you one more.
segments.cn: 所以你买12个，可能是12个可颂，面包师再给你一个。

segments.en: Wow, so you get 13.
Yes, a baker's dozen is 13.
Do you ask for a baker's dozen, or does the baker say, I'm going to give you the baker's dozen?
segments.cn: 你是要求“面包师的打”，还是面包师说，我要给你“面包师的打”？

segments.en: I don't think I've ever asked for it.
segments.cn: 我想我从来没有要求过。

segments.en: I think when I've bought bagels, and I say I want a dozen bagels, they give me a baker's dozen.
segments.cn: 我觉得当我买百吉饼时，我说我想要一打百吉饼，他们给我一个“面包师的打”。

segments.en: They give me 13.
Okay.
So when you're buying bread, now obviously you don't really buy a dozen sourdough breads.
segments.cn: 所以当你买面包时，显然你并不是真的买一打酸面包。

segments.en: You buy a dozen loaves of sourdough bread.
So the countable noun here is a loaf of bread.
segments.cn: 所以这里的可数名词是“一条面包”。

segments.en: One loaf, two loaves.
Now this is very interesting, because in English we don't have that many counting words, measure words.
segments.cn: 现在这很有趣，因为在英语中我们没有那么多计数词，量词。

segments.en: But for bread, we do actually have this special word.
segments.cn: 但对于面包，我们确实有这个特殊的词。

segments.en: So you can say, I would like two loaves of sourdough bread.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，我想要两条酸面包。

segments.en: Okay.
And a loaf, or loaves in the plural, what is it exactly?
segments.cn: 一条面包，或者复数形式的面包，究竟是什么？

segments.en: It's one big piece.
So for example, you have maybe one little piece of bread.
segments.cn: 例如，你可能有一小块面包。

segments.en: It's called a slice.
That's what you eat.
But when you buy the bread, you have many, many, many slices together before you cut the bread.
segments.cn: 但当你买面包时，你有很多很多片在切面包之前。

segments.en: That's called a loaf.
Very good.
So actually this is the reason why the baker, or the person attending the shop, asked if he would like to have the loaf sliced.
segments.cn: 所以实际上这就是面包师，或者店员，问他是否想要把面包切片的原因。

segments.en: Would you like the loaf sliced?
That means, would you like us to cut pieces of bread from this loaf?
segments.cn: 这意味着，你想让我们从这条面包上切出几片吗？

segments.en: Because sliced bread is how you eat it.
segments.cn: 因为切片的面包是你吃的方式。

segments.en: Right, exactly.
You don't really take a whole loaf of bread and start eating it like that.
segments.cn: 你不会真的拿着一整条面包就这样开始吃。

segments.en: Like an animal.
No, you cut it into slices.
And so sliced bread, we say, is one option.
segments.cn: 所以我们说切片的面包是一种选择。

segments.en: You can also have unsliced, which means when you go home, you cut it yourself.
segments.cn: 你也可以选择不切，这意味着回家后你自己切。

segments.en: So this is a very particular word as well, because you have the adjective to have sliced bread, right?
segments.cn: 所以这也是一个非常特别的词，因为你有形容词“切片的面包”，对吧？

segments.en: You also have the verb to slice the bread.
That means to cut it into slices.
And of course you have the noun slices of bread.
segments.cn: 当然你还有名词“面包片”。

segments.en: So you have the individual pieces.
So it can be a verb, an adjective, and a noun.
segments.cn: 所以它可以是动词、形容词和名词。

segments.en: That's right.
So it can be a little confusing, but I recommend you all check out the website and practice a little bit in the comments section.
segments.cn: 所以这可能有点混淆，但我建议你们都去网站上看看，并在评论区练习一下。

segments.en: All right, good.
So let's take a listen to the dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 所以让我们最后再听一遍对话。

segments.en: Welcome to Al's Bakery.
segments.cn: 欢迎来到阿尔的面包店。

segments.en: What can I get you?
Hi, let me get a dozen croissants, four blueberry muffins, and a loaf of sourdough bread.
segments.cn: 嗨，我要一打可颂，四个蓝莓松饼和一条酸面包。

segments.en: Sure.
Would you like to have the loaf sliced?
No, that's okay.
Do you have any whole wheat bread?
Oh, we're out at the moment.
May I suggest some rye bread?
segments.cn: 我可以推荐一些黑麦面包吗？

segments.en: Sure, that sounds good.
Do you have any cakes?
We have various birthday cakes and also some ice cream cakes.
segments.cn: 我们有各种生日蛋糕，还有一些冰淇淋蛋糕。

segments.en: I'll just take a cheesecake.
Will that be all?
Yes.
Your total is $43.20.
All right, so speaking about breads now, there is some particular ingredients that we don't mention in the dialogue, obviously, but they're worth mentioning.
segments.cn: 好的，所以说到面包，现在有一些特别的成分我们在对话中没有提到，显然，但值得一提。

segments.en: What is the one main characteristic that most breads have?
segments.cn: 大多数面包的一个主要特征是什么？

segments.en: Yeast.
Yeast.
That's right.
Y-E-A-S-T.
Yeast.
And yeast is actually alive.
segments.cn: 而且酵母实际上是活的。

segments.en: It's an animal.
It's like a bacteria.
That's right.
And so you wonder why are some breads flat and why are some breads big, poofy, large?
segments.cn: 所以你会想，为什么有些面包是扁平的，而有些面包又大又蓬松？

segments.en: Well, yeast is why.
Basically, you can't have a big poofy bread, a big, large, tall bread, unless you have this yeast.
segments.cn: 基本上，除非你有这种酵母，否则你不能做出大而蓬松的面包。

segments.en: So yeast is what makes the bread rise.
segments.cn: 所以酵母是让面包发酵的原因。

segments.en: Yes.
And we also mentioned flour, which is basically just a powder made out of some type of grain, usually.
segments.cn: 我们还提到了面粉，基本上就是由某种谷物制成的粉末，通常是这样。

segments.en: Yeah, usually it's made out of wheat.
segments.cn: 是的，通常是由小麦制成的。

segments.en: Obviously, whole wheat is a little bit different from the white flour, which would be different processed wheat.
segments.cn: 显然，全麦和白面粉有点不同，白面粉是经过不同加工的小麦。

segments.en: But we also have different things that you can even have rice flour.
segments.cn: 但我们也有不同的东西，比如米粉。

segments.en: Right, corn flour.
Corn flour.
So corn bread would be, of course, yellow because corn is yellow.
segments.cn: 所以玉米面包当然是黄色的，因为玉米是黄色的。

segments.en: Now, so you can hear that we say the word flour, like a Rose is a flower, but it's actually spelled different.
segments.cn: 现在，你可以听到我们说“面粉”这个词，就像“玫瑰是花”，但它的拼写是不同的。

segments.en: F-L-O-U-R, flour.
So there's two different things.
segments.cn: 所以有两种不同的东西。

segments.en: There's flowers in your garden, and there's flour, F-L-O-U-R, which is something you can cook with.
segments.cn: 你花园里的花和可以用来烹饪的面粉，F-L-O-U-R。

segments.en: That's right.
These are called homophones.
So they basically have the same pronunciation, but very different spellings.
segments.cn: 所以它们基本上发音相同，但拼写非常不同。

segments.en: And very different meanings.
Exactly.
So a very interesting lesson for us today.
segments.cn: 今天对我们来说是一个非常有趣的课程。

segments.en: Go out, get some bread, try some of these if you have them available, but also come to the questions and comments section and tell us about maybe your local bread.
segments.cn: 出去，买些面包，如果有的话尝试一下，但也来问答和评论区告诉我们你当地的面包。

segments.en: I know that many countries around the world have very specific types of bread.
segments.cn: 我知道世界上许多国家都有非常特定类型的面包。

segments.en: That's right.
Write some names down for us, send us your pictures, and we'll see you on the website.
segments.cn: 写下几个名字，给我们发你的照片，我们在网站上见。

segments.en: All right.
Bye, guys.
Bye.
